009package imagingbook.common.geometry.line;
010
011import java.util.Locale;
012
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
014import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
015
016/**
017 * This class represents a line in slope-intercept form: y = k x + d.
018 * Instances are immutable. Not all possible lines in the 2D plane
019 * can be represented.
020 * A {@link SlopeInterceptLine} is really a {@link AlgebraicLine}
021 * with two additional fields and a special constructor.
022 */
023public class SlopeInterceptLine extends AlgebraicLine {
024        
025        private final double k, d;
026        
027        public SlopeInterceptLine(double k, double d) {
028                super(k, -1, d);
029                this.k = k;
030                this.d = d;
031        }
032        
033        public double getK() {
034//              return k;
035                return A / -B;
036        }
037
038        public double getD() {
039//              return d;
040                return C / - B;
041        }
042        
043        public double[] getParameters() {
044                return new double[] {k, d};
045        }
046        
047        public static SlopeInterceptLine from(AlgebraicLine al) {
048                double[] p = al.getParameters();        // =(A,B,C)
049                if (Arithmetic.isZero(p[1])) {          // B == 0?
050                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot convert vertical line (B=0)");
051                }
052                return new SlopeInterceptLine(-p[0]/p[1], -p[2]/p[1]);  // =(-A/B, -C/B)
053        }
054        
055        public double getY(double x) {
056                return k * x + d;
057        }
058        
059        // --------------------------------------------------
060        
061        @Override
062        public boolean equals(Object other) {
063                if (this == other) {
064                        return true;
065                }
066                if (other instanceof SlopeInterceptLine) {
067                        return this.equals((SlopeInterceptLine) other, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
068                }
069                else {
070                        return false;
071                }
072        }
073        
074        public boolean equals(SlopeInterceptLine other, double tolerance) {
075                return 
076                                Arithmetic.equals(k, other.k, tolerance) &&
077                                Arithmetic.equals(d, other.d, tolerance);
078        }
079        
080        @Override
081        public String toString() {
082                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <k=%.3f, d=%.3f> A=%.3f B=%.3f C=%.3f",
083                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), k, d, A, B, C);
084        }
085        
086        // --------------------------------------------------
087        
088        public static void main (String[] args) {
089                Pnt2d p1 = Pnt2d.from(1, 2);
090                Pnt2d p2 = Pnt2d.from(4, 3);
091                
092                AlgebraicLine al1 = AlgebraicLine.from(p1, p2);
093                System.out.println("al1 = " + al1);
094                
095                SlopeInterceptLine sl = SlopeInterceptLine.from(al1);
096                System.out.println("sl = " + sl);
097                System.out.println("sl k = " + (sl.A / -sl.B));
098                System.out.println("sl d = " + (sl.C / -sl.B));
099                
100                AlgebraicLine al2 = AlgebraicLine.from(sl);
101                System.out.println("al2 = " + al2);
102                
103                System.out.println("al1 = al2 ? " + al1.equals(al2, 1e-6));
104        }
105        /*
106        al1 = AlgebraicLine <a=-0.316, b=0.949, c=-1.581>
107        sl = SlopeInterceptLine <k=0.333, d=1.667>
108        al2 = AlgebraicLine <a=0.316, b=-0.949, c=1.581>
109        al1 = al2 ? true
110        */
111}
